themes.theme: China-US Rare Earth Negotiations - Risk-On Rally
themes.thesis: STRENGTHENED WITH RESEARCH 13: Market underpricing positive trade deal outcome. Author sees 80% probability of tariff agreement vs market pricing for continued tensions. Gold at highs on geopolitical fear - vulnerable to sharp reversal on deal. Risk/reward heavily skewed to upside on trade resolution.

catalyst.event: Xi-Trump Summit / Trade Deal Announcement
catalyst.date: Next 7-14 days (talks continuing week of 2025-11-01, summit imminent)
catalyst.expected_outcome: Partial de-escalation or framework agreement - tariffs reduced in exchange for China investments. Rare earth export restrictions eased.
catalyst.status_note: Nov 10 initial target passed, but talks continuing per Research 11. Summit still on track per Trump interview. Active catalyst window.

picks.rationale: China Large Cap ETF - direct beneficiary of trade deal. Exports to US down 27%, deal unlocks pent-up demand. Risk/reward highly asymmetric on positive news. Research 11 emphasizes 'ball held underwater' dynamic - release = explosive upside.
picks.catalyst: Trade deal announcement + China export recovery

picks.rationale: US Industrials - benefit from easing trade tensions, capex cycle acceleration, and cyclical rotation. PMI poised to move higher (Research 11: 'inflection, expect 60 next year').
picks.catalyst: Trade deal + manufacturing PMI acceleration

picks.rationale: Small caps bottomed in August, rallying on junk/quality reversal. Rate cuts + strong earnings + trade resolution = continued outperformance. Trading IWM/SPY ratio at inflection. Research 11 reinforces: strong earnings (10% into season, blowout results).
picks.catalyst: Fed cuts + PMI up-move + China deal

picks.rationale: Agricultural commodities ETF. China resuming soybean purchases is explicit part of trade deal framework (from Research 5).
picks.catalyst: Agricultural commodity purchases restart post-deal

picks.rationale: Gold suffered biggest momentum shock since liberation day. Trade deal would reverse entire summer rally. Retail inflows at extremes. Every macro bear owns gold.
picks.catalyst: China-US deal eliminates safe haven bid

picks.rationale: Revenue $225B currently, sell-side sees $425B by 2030. Core AI infrastructure play. Only 40% of datacenter capex is compute - NVDA captures this high-margin segment.
picks.catalyst: Q4 earnings mid-December + continued AI inference acceleration

picks.rationale: Broad tech exposure to AI deflation beneficiaries. Historical pattern: Fed cuts + double-digit earnings growth + no recession = equities higher next year.
picks.catalyst: Year-end positioning into Fed easing cycle

themes.exit_trigger: If summit canceled OR Trump announces new tariff escalation OR IWM breaks below 50-day MA

themes.validation_summary: QT end announced Oct 29, SRF usage peaked Oct 31, resolved early Nov, KRE recovered

themes.theme: AI Semiconductor Bottleneck - Memory Super Cycle
themes.thesis: PROMOTED TO IMMEDIATE + STRENGTHENED WITH RESEARCH 11: Recursive self-improvement models already achieved internally at OpenAI/Google per MIT insiders. Bottleneck is 100% physical infrastructure (HBM, power, cooling). Inference workloads (not training) now driving demand - structural 24/7 memory cycle through 2027. Semis up 5.4% best week since June. Q3 earnings blowouts across TSMC, ASML, Applied Materials, Micron. Micron up 3x since April on AI memory demand (from Research 5). HBM supply constraints meeting exponential demand growth. RESEARCH 13 ADDS: DRAM prices surged from September lows to recent highs - bigger move than gold rally nobody talks about. Memory shortage is THE constraint on AI deployment. Micron reports soon with massive backlog visibility.

catalyst.event: Tesla Shareholder Meeting - Optimus 3 Reveal + Q4 Semiconductor Earnings
catalyst.date: 2025-11-06 (passed 20 days ago) + Micron Q1 earnings Dec 2025
catalyst.expected_outcome: Humanoid robot unveiling creates iPhone moment for robotics. Accelerates edge AI + NPU demand. Micron earnings confirm sustained HBM tightness.
catalyst.status_note: Nov 6 Tesla meeting passed. Optimus 3 reveal (if occurred) validates edge AI thesis. Micron Q1 earnings December = next immediate catalyst for memory demand confirmation.

picks.rationale: Memory leader, surged 60→200 this year. HBM demand structural not cyclical. Inference = 24/7 memory demand. 2027 super cycle confirmed. Research 5: already 3x from April, embodied AI (robotaxis, humanoids) requires more memory than LLMs.
picks.catalyst: Q1 earnings Dec 2025 + inference workload explosion

picks.rationale: AI factory moat (not just chip). Performance-per-watt leadership. Customers deploy gigawatt scale (400-500k GPUs). No dark GPUs = no demand problem. Capacity overhang = roadmap not warning. Research 8: Stargate $400B potential revenue, 30x Blackwell performance vs Hopper.
picks.catalyst: Continued hyperscaler capex $350B→$500B next year

picks.rationale: Fab equipment essential for chip production scaling. Blowout Q3 earnings, 84% revenue growth. Positioned for 2025-2027 buildout.
picks.catalyst: Capex acceleration + memory super cycle

picks.rationale: Broad semiconductor exposure. Up 5.4% best week since June per Research 11. Captures entire AI infrastructure stack (memory, GPUs, fab equipment).
picks.catalyst: Hyperscaler capex $350B→$500B 2026

Powell signaled QT ending soon, possibly next meeting. Liquidity issues + strong earnings (10% into season, blowout results) = Fed forced to act. Credit fears spreading but earnings strong.

themes.thesis: Bridgewater notes gold is 'pretty expensive by historical terms' at $4,000 vs other inflation hedges. Western investors have alternatives: TIPS, equities, Bitcoin. Gold-specific premium creates opportunity in cheaper alternatives that still offer inflation/debasement protection. Gold disconnected from broader debasement indicators (Bitcoin, silver, yield curve). Research 11 macro context: inflation declining (gas $3.05 down from $3.20), S&P at ATH despite China trade war.

catalyst.event: Market realization that gold rally disconnected from broader debasement theme
catalyst.expected_outcome: Rotation from expensive gold into cheaper inflation hedges

picks.rationale: US TIPS offer inflation protection at lower cost than gold. Bridgewater explicitly mentions 'inflation linked bonds' as alternative. Real yields attractive if fiscal concerns persist.
picks.catalyst: Fiscal profligacy continues (government shutdown resolution, deficit data)

picks.rationale: Bitcoin noted as having 'disconnected' from gold despite similar debasement narrative. Catch-up opportunity if gold thesis is real. Research 11 notes BTC bottomed with S&P historically, now down while S&P at ATH = divergence.
picks.catalyst: Bitcoin re-correlates with gold debasement theme

picks.rationale: Silver 'outstripped by gold relative to normal beta'. Cheaper alternative with industrial demand kicker. Mean reversion play.

themes.theme: Balance Sheet Runoff Ending - Bank Beneficiaries

catalyst.event: Fed Balance Sheet Runoff Decision / FOMC Meeting
catalyst.expected_outcome: Announcement of QT pause or slowdown

picks.rationale: Largest reserve holder, benefits from higher IOER (interest on reserves) as Fed maintains elevated rates. Balance sheet runoff pause stabilizes funding costs.
picks.catalyst: Q4 earnings + Fed QT pause announcement

picks.rationale: Broad financials exposure, sector benefits from Fed maintaining ample reserves regime without further liquidity drain

themes.theme: Treasury Bill Supply Surge - Front-End Yield Compression
themes.thesis: Treasury planning $143B net bill increase in Q1 FY26 (Oct-Dec 2025) vs $537B in Q4 FY25. Sharp reduction in short-term supply while coupon issuance stays constant at ~$447B. Front-end yields will compress as bill supply normalizes, creating opportunity in 1-3 month bills and money market funds facing reinvestment risk.

catalyst.event: Treasury Quarterly Refunding Announcement
catalyst.expected_outcome: Market repricing of front-end curve as bill supply drops 73% QoQ

picks.rationale: Short-term Treasury ETF (0-12 month). Benefits from current elevated front-end yields before compression. High liquidity for quick repositioning.
0-3 month Treasury bills. Captures highest current yields before supply reduction drives rates lower. Zero duration risk.

themes.theme: Long-Duration Treasury Relative Value - Supply Imbalance
themes.thesis: Net issuance heavily skewed to front-end. 20-year and 30-year TIPS showing zero net issuance in Q1 FY26. 30-year nominal only $69B gross vs $210B in 5-year. Long-end supply constraints while Fed easing cycle begins creates steepening opportunity.

catalyst.event: December FOMC Meeting

picks.rationale: 20+ year Treasury ETF. Benefits from: 1) Reduced long-end supply 2) Fed easing cycle 3) Duration play as front-end yields compress. Highest conviction long-duration vehicle.
Long-term Treasury ETF (10-30 year). Lower expense ratio than TLT. Captures curve steepening from supply dynamics.
